DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection Plasma Aliquot Dry Ice Placement Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time when the plasma was placed on dry ice.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Collection Plasma Aliquot Dry Ice Placement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation._Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight._A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat._The act of putting something into a position or location.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Collection Plasma Aliquot Dry Ice Placement
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.:Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.:Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.:A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat.:The act of putting something into a position or location.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.
A solid form of carbon dioxide used as a refrigerant. At temperatures above -78.5 degrees C and ambient pressure, it changes directly to a gas as it absorbs heat.
The act of putting something into a position or location.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the time at which an event was observed or occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
